title.narrative: 2.2 CASE MANAGEMENT OF CHILDREN IN CONTACT WITH THE LAW

description.narrative: 2.2 Police, first responders, judiciary system have capacities, protocols and procedures for effective, accountable, accessible case management of children in contact with the law, which contributes to Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: New Element

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 2.2 Police, first responders, judiciary system have capacities, protocols and procedures for effective, accountable, accessiblecase management of children in contact with the law

description.narrative: Despite the challenges of the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic and team transition, new in-service and pre-service training modules for police forces and family judges and auditors dealing with children in contact with the law were developed and field tested, working closely with the Police and National Guard Academies and the Higher Institute of Justice. Over 200 vulnerable children in conflict with the law received free legal representation coupled with capacity building and advocacy for alternatives to deprivation, working with the Juvenile Justice Office in the Ministry of Justice and civil society organisations. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:17/12/2021
